intro: Emiliella epapposa, commonly known as the red-stemmed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers, typically blooming in spring. Its stems are covered in fine, reddish hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Emiliella epapposa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
